alert.note: Alert for Giles; Marshall (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 12 at 5:30PM CDT by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Marshall, northeastern Giles and Bedford Counties through 615 PM CDT... At 530 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Lewisburg, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Shelbyville, Lewisburg, Chapel Hill, Cornersville, Wartrace, Bell Buckle, Normandy, Raus, Belfast, Deason, Farmington, Unionville and Beechgrove. This includes the following highways... Interstate 65 near mile marker 19. Interstate 24 near mile marker 97. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for Middle Tennessee.
